item.title: Understanding Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP)
item.description: Introduction Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) is a network layer protocol used in Cisco devices to share information about directly connected devices. As a proprietary protocol of Cisco, CDP plays a crucial role in network management and troubleshooting by allowing network devices to discover and learn about each other. Use Cases for CDP CDP is particularly useful in: Network Mapping: Automatically discovering Cisco devices within the network, helping in creating a network topology map.
